binet 0.2
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • How to use this package

Projections of a bipartite network

projections.Rd

TBD

projections(
  proximity_source,
  proximity_target,
  source = "source",
  target = "target",
  value = "value",
  avg_links = 4,
  tolerance = 0.05,
  compute = "both"
)

Arguments

proximity_source

a data frame containing proximity values for the elements of set X (e.g. proximity_source from proximity())
proximity_target

a data frame containing proximity values for the elements of set Y (e.g. proximity_target from proximity())
source

a column with the elements of set X (applies only if data is a data frame).
target

a column with the elements of set Y (applies only if data is a data frame).
value

a column with the proximity values between the elements of X or Y (applies only if data is a data frame).
avg_links

average number of connections for the projection of X (default set to 4)
tolerance

tolerance for proximity variation on each iteration until obtaining the desired average number of connections (default set to 0.05)
compute

which projection to compute. By default is "both" (both projections) but it can also be "source" or "target".

Details

TBD

References

For more information see:

Hausmann R, Hidalgo C, Bustos S, Coscia M, Simoes A, Yildirim M (2014). The atlas of economic complexity: Mapping paths to prosperity. MIT Press. doi: 10.7551/mitpress/9647.001.0001 .

and the references therein.

Examples

projections(
  proximity_source = binet_output$proximity$proximity_source,
  proximity_target = binet_output$proximity$proximity_target
)
#> computing target projection...
#> --------------------------------------------------
#> 0 threshold...
#> 0.05 threshold...
#> 0.1 threshold...
#> 0.15 threshold...
#> 0.2 threshold...
#> 0.25 threshold...
#> 0.3 threshold...
#> 0.35 threshold achieves the avg number of connections
#> computing target projection...
#> --------------------------------------------------
#> 0 threshold...
#> 0.05 threshold...
#> 0.1 threshold...
#> 0.15 threshold...
#> 0.2 threshold...
#> 0.25 threshold...
#> 0.3 threshold...
#> 0.35 threshold...
#> 0.4 threshold...
#> 0.45 threshold...
#> 0.5 threshold...
#> 0.55 threshold...
#> 0.6 threshold...
#> 0.65 threshold...
#> 0.7 threshold achieves the avg number of connections
#> $network_source
#> # A tibble: 272 x 3

#>    <chr>  <chr>  <dbl>
